metadata.title: CVE-2022-3435 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability classified as problematic has been found in Linux Kernel.This affects the function fib_nh_match of the file net/ipv4/fib_semantics.cof the component IPv4 Handler. The manipulation leads to out-of-boundsread. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. It is recommended toapply a patch to fix this issue. The identifier VDB-210357 was assigned tothis vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3435` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1

linux-image-extra-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required
